questionTitle: ___ executive and administrative authority in the United States government rests with a President who is elected for a four-year term.
___ tributaries of the Mississippi River system were navigated by steamboats during the period before the outbreak of the Civil War
Before 8000 B.C. wheat did not grow as prolifically ___ it does today.
__________ one time, Manchester, New Hampshire, was the home of the most productive cotton mills in the world.
My opinion is that they don't know what to do and are merely playing ___ time.
That plant is ________ big that it should really be moved outside.
Sound comes in waves, and the higher the frequency, ________.
When sugar ________ to yeast, fermentation takes place.
Your new car ________ as well as speedy.
In 1885 photography changed dramatically ________ introduced paper-based film.
That magnificent ________ temple was constructed by the Chinese.
Waitresses and waiters who serve ________ deserve at least a 20 percent tip.
________ of the play, 'Mourning Becomes Electra', introduces the cast of characters and hints at the plot.
________ have a powerful influence on the shape of the entire magazine industry.
A home computer ________ an opportunity for convenient and efficient work at home.
Uranus is just ________ to be seen on a clear night with the naked eye.
According to estimates by some botanists, there are ________ of plants.
Manufacturers often sacrifice quality ________.
anwers: in place of to earn more money
to gain more quantities of money
and instead earn a bigger amount of profit

questionTitle: According to a recent survey, ________ doctors do not have a personal physician.
The Kilauea volcano ________ on the eastern slope of the larger Mauna Loa volcano.
